column2: What do you pay for inpatient respite care under hospice care?
column3: Five percent of the Medicare-approved amount

column2: What are the requirements for Medicare coverage of a yearly lung cancer screening?
column3: You must be 50‚Äì77 years old, asymptomatic, a current smoker or have quit within the last 15 years, and have a tobacco smoking history of at least 20 pack years

column2: What type of Medicare coverage does not allow you to join a separate Medicare drug plan?
column3: Medicare Advantage

column2: What are the conditions under which the opioid safety reviews and Drug Management Programs do not apply?
column3: If you have cancer or sickle cell disease, are getting palliative or end-of-life care, are in hospice, or live in a long-term care facility

column2: How do you qualify for premium-free Part A?
column3: If you or your spouse paid Medicare taxes while working for a certain amount of time.

column2: What period allows you to change your Medicare health or drug coverage for the upcoming year?
column3: October 15 to December 7

column2: What are the four kinds of Medicare Savings Programs?
column3: Qualified Medicare Beneficiary (QMB) Program, Specified Low-Income Medicare Beneficiary (SLMB) Program, Qualifying Individual (QI) Program, Qualified Disabled and Working Individuals (QDWI) Program

column2: What is the Medication Therapy Management program?
column3: A service offered by Medicare Part D plans to help members manage their medications safely, usually involving a discussion with a pharmacist or health care provider

column2: What is Medicare‚Äôs Blue Button used for?
column3: Downloading your personal health information like your Part A, Part B, and Part D claims to a file on your computer or other device

column2: What type of care does Medicare now cover monthly services for if you've been living with it for more than 3 months?
column3: Chronic pain

column2: What is an Accountable Care Organization (ACO)?
column3: A group of doctors, hospitals, and other health care providers that have teamed up to coordinate your health care

column2: How much do you pay for a Medicare-covered hospice care?
column3: Nothing for hospice care

column2: What is the Part B late enrollment penalty?
column3: Your monthly Part B premium may go up 10% for each full 12 months that you could've had Part B but didn't sign up.

column2: What are the consequences of not having creditable prescription drug coverage?
column3: You may have to pay a late enrollment penalty if you join a Part D plan later.

column2: How often can a Medicare beneficiary receive a pneumococcal vaccine at no cost?
column3: Medicare covers pneumococcal shots to help prevent pneumococcal infections like certain types of pneumonia, without specifying a limit on frequency

column2: Can you use Medigap to pay for costs you have with a Medicare Advantage Plan?
column3: No.

column2: For how long do you have to have a disability before automatically getting Medicare Part A and Part B?
column3: 24 months of disability benefits

column2: How can you get Medicare information in an accessible format?
column3: Call 1-800-MEDICARE, email altformatrequest@cms.hhs.gov, send a fax to 1-844-530-3676, or send a letter to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services with your request

column2: What is the new coverage benefit related to vaccines under Medicare?
column3: Recommended adult vaccines are now available at no cost

column2: How often does Medicare cover abdominal aortic aneurysm screenings?
column3: Once, if you're at risk

column2: What are some of the methods Medicare plans use to manage prescription drug coverage?
column3: Prior authorization, quantity limits, step therapy, medication safety checks at the pharmacy, and drug management programs

column2: What is the Income Related Monthly Adjustment Amount (IRMAA)?
column3: An extra charge added to your premium if your modified adjusted gross income is above a certain amount.

column2: What are the two conditions that must be met to qualify for hospice care?
column3: A hospice doctor and your doctor must certify that you're terminally ill with a life expectancy of 6 months or less, and you must sign a statement choosing hospice care instead of other Medicare-covered treatments for your terminal illness and related conditions.

column2: What should you do if you receive a notice that your Medicare plan is not participating in Medicare for the coming year?
column3: You can choose another plan from October 15 to December 7, with coverage beginning January 1

column2: What is the maximum frequency for Medicare-covered sexually transmitted infection (STI) screenings?
column3: Once every 12 months or at certain times during pregnancy

column2: How can you avoid paying a late enrollment penalty for Medicare drug coverage?
column3: Get Medicare drug coverage when first eligible, add Medicare drug coverage if you lose other creditable coverage, and keep records of your creditable prescription drug coverage.

column2: What should you do before making changes to your Medicare Advantage Plan?
column3: Talk to your employer, union, or other benefits administrator about their rules.

column2: What should you do if you need a replacement Medicare card because it's damaged or lost?
column3: Visit Medicare.gov to log into (or create) your secure Medicare account to print or order an official copy of your Medicare card

column2: What types of individuals are SNPs designed to serve?
column3: People with specific diseases, certain health care needs, or who also have Medicaid coverage.

column2: What specific safety checks do pharmacies perform before filling prescriptions under Medicare plans?
column3: Checking for drug interactions, incorrect dosages, and possible unsafe amounts of opioid pain medications
